title.narrative: 1.4.3 REDUCE DISPARITY IN PRIMARY/GRADE5

description.narrative: Disparity between 20 convergence districts including selected urban slums and national average for NER at primary level and grade-5 completion rate is reduced by 50 per cent., which contributes to Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By the end of 2016, women, children and youth in 20 selected districts, demand and benefit from increased and more equitable utilization of quality health, nutrition, population, education, water, sanitation and HIV services

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Disparity between 20 convergence districts including selected urban slums and national average for NER at primary level and grade-5completion rate is reduced by 50 per cent.

description.narrative: Disparities between the convergence districts and national average was addressed through initiatives to reduce the number of out-of-school children, ABAL, and life skills training. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2016

title.narrative: Number of 8-14 year old out of school children completing second chance education equivalent to grade 5 in selected urban slums and UNDAF districts with UNICEF funds
No. of 14-18 yr old OOSC completing livelihood skills training in selected urban slums and UNDAF dists (with UNICEF funds)
Ministry of Primary and Mass Education has approved Second Chance Education Implementation guidelines
Out of school children in the reporting year accessing formal or non-formal education with support of UNICEF

actual.value: 2016:Total reach is 85,187 of which, 65,000 PPE aged out of school children and 20,187 primary out of school children directly by UNICEF support. In addition to this, with UNICEF's technical support, identification of 100,000 OoSC for primary education were undertaken for Second Chance Education.
